title: Pricey Jet Fuel Punishes Airlines and Passengers
sub_head: Air travelâ€™s recovery is challenged as jet fuel rises faster than gasoline
body:
American drivers are feeling the pain of rising gasoline prices. Airlines and their customers have had it even worse.
Jet fuel, a kerosene-based product akin to diesel fuel, has roughly doubled in price since last April across the U.S., according to S&P Global Commodity Insights, while gasoline has risen about 45%. A fall in exports of Russian diesel in recent weeks has driven Western refiners to shift resources from jet to diesel production, leaving jet fuel undersupplied, S&P Global Commodity Insights analysts said.
